news uk-news kate-middleton-sends-rare-tweet-"Kate Middleton releases photographs to mark th birthdayByZoe ForseyFeatures Editor:,  Jan | commentsThe Duke and Duchess of Cambridge have a team of loyal and talented staff running their popular social media accounts, sharing details of their royal duties and charity projects. But every now and again Kate and William take over the keyboard and send personal messages themselves.William does it more regularly than his we, normally sending messages about sport, however today, on Kateaposs th birthday, the Duchess sent her own message.Alongside one of the three new photos shared to mark the milestone birthday, she wrote: Thank you for all of your very kind birthday wishes, and to Paolo and the National Portrait Gallery for these three special portraits. To let fans know the message was from her and not her staff, she signed it off aposCapos. Kate rarely sends personal messages, however the couple took to their phones to send a tweet on Christmas Day. They wrote: This Christmas will be dferent to what so many of us had planned.From those who are alone or having to isolate away from loved ones, to the incredible people supporting our NHS and caring for those most in need – we are thinking of you. W  CBefore today, the last solo tweet Kate sent was on November  to mark a visit to celebrate the Poppy Appealaposs th anniversary. She wrote: It was a true honour to spend time with Colonel Blum and thank him for the sacrices he made for our country. Speaking to him highlighted again to me why Remembrance is so important, and why we must pay our gratitude to those who fought and died so we could live in peace today.  We must keep their stories alive for generations to come. And many congratulations to Emily for receiving her Centenary Remembrance Badge! C The Queen and Prince Charles joined people around the world in publicly wishing Kate a happy birthday today. The monarch shared four snaps on the official royal accounts, all showing her with her grandsonaposs we. Her message wrote: Wishing The Duchess of Cambridge a very happy th birthday today! She also added a red balloon emoji. Prince Charles and Camilla also used social media to send a public message to their daughter in law, writing: Wishing the Duchess of Cambridge a very happy th birthday today! Kate is holding off her big celebrations until later in the year, when sheaposs expected to have a joint party with William - who hits the landmark age in June. Traditionally, the Queen will through a bash to mark the occasions, with Windsor Castle or Sandringham among the likely venues. Similar lavish bashes have previously been thrown to jointly celebrate signicant birthdays of several members of the family at the same time. Back in June  a huge do was held at Windsor to celebrate Prince Andrew’s th birthday, Princess Anne’s th, Princess Margaret’s th and William’s th. A source told the Mirror: “It’s very much a scaled-down occasion this year for the Duchess, who will celebrate privately with her family. “Of course she is mindful of the current situation. She will be surrounded by loved-ones and that’s all that matters.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Kate Middleton, Duchess of CambridgeRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news kate-middletons-transformation-shy-waity-"Kate Middleton plays piano at Christmas carol serviceByAmanda Killelea:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments As the Duchess of Cambridge turns  today, she has every reason to celebrate. Not only is she happily married to Prince William and the mother of three beautul children, but she has a vital role to play in the modern monarchy.Our elegant future Queen, who prefers to be known as Catherine, has come a long way from the shy university student who first caught William’s eye. Indeed, the Duchess – who recently played piano in front of millions at her Christmas carol concert – appears to grow in confidence each day. Royal commentator Richard Fitzwilliams says: “Kate has the world at her feet as she turns . There have been many ups, and she hasn’t had any downs. She and William pack a punch.” Here, Richard and our  of experts – psychologist Lee Chambers, stylist Martine Alexander and body language expert Andy Coley – explain how Kate has become a true st century princess. Relationships In , Kate met William at St Andrew’s University in Scotland. She was .At the time, some cruelly refered to the fact middle-class Kate was a “commoner” and before the couple’s engagement was announced in , she was nicknamed ‘Waity Katie’. But behind the scenes, William had been taking time to make sure Kate was truly ready for royal le. Richard says: “It was very sensible in the circumstances for Kate and William to get to know each other over theof time that they felt appropriate. But it can be hurtful seeing those headlines and obviously very stressful.  “William handled this by giving them as much privacy as possible, especially in the early years.” And just as William has been there for Kate, she has been there for him, too. “They are a mutual support for one another,” Richard says. “William and Kate are the perfect team.” Fashion  Another sign of Kate’s growing confidence is how her sense of style has evolved over the years. And whatever she wears – whether it’s a vest top and jeans or a dazzling gown – Kate’s choice of clothing can sell out in seconds. Celebrity stylist Martine says: “She is % a style icon. She ticks the style etiquette box that comes with the job, but is confident enough to express who she is. “I love the more casual, preppy, classic side of Kate. And I absolutely love how she mixes high street brands with designer items. It makes her much more approachable. “And the gold gown she wore to the Bond premiere was % iconic. It is just insane – it is Kate being Kate. She is making a statement, but doing it in a classic way.” Motherhood  Becoming a mother in  had a profound effect on Kate, and she often speaks about the guilt she feels as a working mum. But psychologist Lee says that parenting George, eight, Charlotte, six, and three-year-old Louis will have given Kate a vital new set of skills. ”What has become most obvious in recent years is how she has found a harmony of being a royal figurehead without losing her authenticity,” he says.  “It is finding this groove that has given her a certain gravitas and influence – and motherhood has certainly amplied her evolution. “Having three children and signicant royal duties can be challenging, but motherhood itself is useful when bringing together a wider family, and certainly hones your communication skills, patience and presence.” Family  Kate has often recalled her happy childhood with parents Carole and Michael and siblings Pippa and James. And Richard believes her family provided the perfect grounding and support network to navigate becoming part of the monarchy. “I do think a lot of the credit should go to the Middletons,” he says. “The fact that she had a happy childhood, the grounding she had, the education she had…” But Kate has also had to deal with the fallout of Harry and Meghan deciding to quit royal le and their bombshell Oprah interview.  Richard says: “Very little has been said overall about the relationship between Kate and Meghan. But the fact is that Catherine and Meghan are very dferent characters. I don’t think they would ever necessarily have been close. “The problems with the Sussexes put pressure on the Cambridges. It can’t have been easy.” Body language  When she first started dating William, Kate often looked uncomfortable in the spotlight. Body language expert Andy says: “In the early days, Kate seemed defensive and awkward in public. “She would hold her bag across her body in a protective gesture or have her hands to her face or neck, which can be a sign of a lack of confidence.” But in recent months and years, the Duchess appears to have relaxed and now appears to relish being in the public eye.  Andy says: “At the Bond premiere she looks like she is loving the event. “There is a sparkle about her that doesn’t look forced – one of those, ‘Not sure how I made it here, but I bloody love it’ moments that people in the limelight have when they embrace the attention. “The carol concert is the most relaxed I’ve seen her. I remember thinking to myself how at ease she looked playing the piano not looking about, just concentrating fully on being present in her music. Her face and smile came out once the tune had been played and there was a genuine warmth to the look.” Charity work  On April , , William and Kate married at Westminster Abbey. From that day, she became a full-time working royal but Kate didn’t rush in to anything. With William’s support, she planned how she would use her royal role as a force for good and hand-picked patronages to reflect her own passions, such as children, mental health, sport and art. Richard says: “When they do engagements and there is the possibility of doing something informal, such as playing a game, they do it. It shows the rapport between them. “At one time, I think the Duke of Edinburgh had  patronages. William and Catherine have far fewer but the idea has been to do more with fewer. It is a dferent approach.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Kate Middleton, Duchess of CambridgePrince WilliamRoyal FamilySunday People" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: parents urged book 12 15
story: Parents urged to book  to -years-olds in for Covid jab as , slots availableParents of children in the specied age group can book in at up to  centres, while there are slots available at around  walk-in sites, NHSEngland has saidParents are being urged to book in Covid jabs for their children Image: Zuma Press PA ImagesByEd HennesseyTanveer MannDeputy News Editor:,  Jan | comments Parents of  to -year-olds are being urged to book Covid- vaccinations for their children with hundreds of thousands appointments available. Around half a million vaccination appointments are being made available online in England this month, a senior doctor said.Parents can book the jabs for the specied age group at up to  centres, while there are slots available at around  walk-in sites. As pupilsfrom the Christmas break, hundreds of schools will be visited over the next fortnight as part of the NHS Covid Vaccination Programme. Dr Nikki Kanani, GP and deputy lead for the NHS vaccine programme, said: “I know how much disruption Covid has caused for so many families over the past two years, affecting young people’s lives and education. “Getting vaccinated protects them, their family and their friends, letting them stay at school and continue socialising. “The vaccine is safe and effective – my -year-old son had his first vaccination when I had my booster at our local pharmacy and it gave us both reassurance that he was protected as well, and he has recently topped up his protection with a second dose.  “Young people can get their le-saving protection at a walk-in site or wait to get vaccinated at school, but the best way to make sure it happens quickly and conveniently is to book online now.” Over . million children aged  to  have had their first dose since September.Health Secretary Sajid Javid said: “Keeping children in school is so important for their education, health and wellbeing. “Vaccines will protect young people from Omicron, help to keep schools open and protect their friends and families. “Many young people can get their first or second dose at school, at walk-in sites or parents can book one of the half a million vaccination appointments up for grabs across the country this month. title: prince andrew in good spirits
story: Prince Andrew in good spirits over Christmas as he thought Maxwell would be clearedPrince Andrew ate Christmas lunch with The Queen at Windsor Castle, but days later the British socialite Ghislaine Maxwell was convicted of recruiting and trafficking young girls for Jeffrey EpsteinPrince Andrew during the infamous interview with BBC Newsnights Emily Maitlis Image: BBCBySarah RobertsonPatrick HillNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan Prince Andrew was in good spirits on Christmas Day as he thought Ghislaine Maxwell would be cleared. But just days later the British socialite was convicted of recruiting and trafficking young girls to be sexually abused by the late American financier Jeffrey Epstein.The Duke of Yorkaposs legal team reportedly told him they believed Maxwell would be cleared, and Andrew was said by sources to be in good spirits as he ate Christmas lunch with The Queen at Windsor Castle, The Sunday Mirror has revealed.However, the prince did not join the royal family for the main Christmas day church service at Sandringham, after deciding to “keep a low profile” over the festive period as he did not want to be a distraction, according to sources. Maxwell, , was found guilty on December  on five of the six counts she faced after five full days of deliberation by a -person jury in New York.  It means the socialite could spend the rest of her le behind bars. Among the guilty verdicts was the most serious charge of sex trafficking a minor. She was also convicted of:transporting a minor with the intent to engage in criminal sexual activity conspiracy to transport minors with intent to engage in criminal sexual activity conspiracy to commit sex trafficking of minors conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex actsShe was cleared of the other charge of enticement of a minor to travel to engage in illegal sex acts. Her lawyer, Bobbi Sternheim, told reporters shortly after the verdict that we firmly believe in Ghislaineaposs innocence. Maxwellaposs legal team has since called for a retrial after two jurors subsequently said they were a victim of sexual abuse. Prince Andrew recently missed a family skiing trip to Geneva with his daughters, Beatrice and Eugenie, after his team advised him it would be “inappropriate” for him to be seen on holiday while facing sex allegations.Hours after the royal party ed home, Andrew suffered a further blow with the publication of a testimony from one of Maxwell’s victims.  Waiving her right to anonymity, Carolyn Andriano, , claimed Andrew’s accuser Ms Giuffre had texted her in March  to say she was going for dinner in London with Andrew, Maxwell and Epstein. She also alleged Ms Giuffre, now , later showed her the infamous picture of herself with Andrew inside Maxwell’s London mews house. The prince is currently waiting to hear whether he will face a civil lawsuit by Virginia Giuffre in the US over sex abuse allegations, which he has always denied.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Ghislaine MaxwellChristmasPrince Andrew, Duke of YorkRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: prince andrews skype calls very
story: Exclusive: Prince Andrews Skype calls with very upset Beatrice and Eugenie after he quit ski tripPrince Andrew was advised it would be inappropriate to join the trip as he awaits a ruling on whether he will face a civil court case over allegations he sexually abused Virginia GiuffrePrince Andrew stayed at home as his family went skiing after his team advised him it would be inappropriate Image: BBCBySarah RobertsonPatrick HillNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan Prince Andrew was advised not to slope off on his family’s ski holiday – fearing the publicity would add to an avalanche of woes. With the world’s eyes on a possible civil court case over sex abuse claims in the US, the Duke of York stayed at home. He was literally a virtual recluse – using Skype for video calls to his people in Verbier, Switzerland. We can reveal he had daily chats with daughters Beatrice and Eugenie and the rest of the party. A source told the Sunday Mirror: “Beatrice and Eugenie were both very upset because they were hoping their children would be able to spend their first ski holiday with their grandad and the entire family. “Sadly it wasn’t to be, but they did hold Skype calls with their father nearly every day while they were in Verbier so that they could support him and he could see the grandchildren on holiday.” Get all the latest news sent to your inbox.for the free Mirror newsletter  It is claimed Andrew, , had been due to fly out with the group. It included ex-we Sarah Ferguson, sons-inlaw Edo Mapelli Mozzi, , and Jack Brooksbank, , plus grandson August,  months, and three-month-old granddaughter Sienna. But the Duke got cold feet after his team advised him it would be “inappropriate” for him to be seen on holiday while facing sex allegations. And Andrew’s former pal Ghislaine Maxwell, , has just been convicted in New York of sex trafficking for Jeffrey Epstein – further complicating any ski jaunt for Andrew.  The Duke is anxiously awaiting a US ruling from Judge Lewis Kaplan on whether he will face a full civil court case over allegations he sexually abused Virginia Giuffre on three occasions in , when she was aged . He vehemently denies the claims. Beatrice, , and Eugenie, , put aside the strain to enjoy the two-week ski break, before flying back from Geneva to Heathrow on Friday. Our source said: “Beatrice and Eugenie fully support their father and are a very close family unit, which includes Sarah. “It’s more about them being there for him and supporting him as opposed to questioning him about the case. That’s not what the family is focused on – it’s about survival, protecting the family name and getting through it in one piece. The girls feel their father’s name is continually dragged through the mud unnecessarily, when really he is a good egg.  “They feel the whole thing is an unfortunate business and they don’t believe their father deserves what is happening to him.” The royal party stayed at Andrew and ex-we Fergie’s £million Swiss chalet. But it could be the family’s final visit as it understood the ski-loving prince is trying to sell the lodge as he faces spiralling legal bills. He and Fergie, , bought it from millionaire French socialite Isabelle de Rouvre for £.million in . But it has been reported they still owe £.million and that legal threats were issued last year after claims of a missed a payment in December . It is believed Andrew and Fergie agreed to sell the seven-bedroom property to a wealthy European investor last September, but the deal has still not been completed.  Andrew and Fergie orced in  but they remain close and have been living under the same roof at Royal Lodge, Windsor, since . The Duke had Christmas lunch with the Queen at Windsor Castle, when sources say he was in “good spirits” after his legal team reportedly told him they believed Maxwell was likely to be cleared. But just four days later she was convicted. Then – hours after the ski party ed home – the Duke suffered a new blow with publication of a testimony from one of Maxwell’s victims. Waiving her right to anonymity, Carolyn Andriano, , claimed Andrew’s accuser Ms Giuffre had texted her in March  to say she was going for dinner in London with Andrew, Maxwell and Epstein. She also alleged Ms Giuffre, now , later showed her the infamous picture of herself with Andrew inside Maxwell’s London mews house.  Carolyn, who was abused by Epstein and Maxwell from the age of , added: “I asked hershe’d been to the Palace. And she said, ‘I got to sleep with him’. “I said, ‘What  You’re f****** with me’, and she said, ‘No, I got to sleep with him’. She didn’t seem upset. She thought it was pretty cool.” The claims came six days after the Sunday Mirror’s exclusive interview with Anthony Figeruoa,  – Ms Giuffre’s boyfriend in . He said Virginia told him she “didn’t want to do it” – referring to sex with Andrew. Anthony says she was “scared” by what Epstein and Maxwell wanted her to do. Andrew has always denied the allegations. ButMs Giuffre’s court case gets the go-ahead and she wins, legal experts predict she could get a £million settlement. She is said to want her day in court to send a message that anyone “with power and privilege” accused of abusing young girls will face justice. The Prince still faces the prospect of being questioned by US authorities investigating links to Epstein. Florida-based lawyer Spencer Kuvin, who represents a number of Epstein victims, told the Mirror: “He now has two close friends convicted, so it should make him very concerned about his future. “I believe the best way forward for him now is to settle. I would tell him he needs to get this case sorted out and fast.” On Friday it emerged the Queen will not pay Andrew’s legal bills, now £million, or any potential settlement. But he has assured her he is innocent and she still backs him. title: prince george starting understand future
story: Prince George starting to understand his future and Kate Middleton has plan for himKate Middleton and Prince Williams oldest son, Prince George, will one day become King - and hes now beginning to understand exactly what that meansByZoe ForseyFeatures EditorJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Jan | commentsPrince Georgeaposs whole le was mapped out in front of him before he was even born. The Duke and Duchess of Cambridgeaposs eldest son is third in line to the throne and will one day become our King. Despite his extraordinary future, his proud parents are determined to give him as aposnormalapos an upbringing as possible, allowing him to enjoy his childhood with siblings Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis. But royal exert Duncan Larcombe claims that George has started to understand his role and what his adult le has in store - and mum Kate has a solid plan of how to help him cope and prepare him.He told OK! magazine : “George is only just beginning to understand his destiny, but Kate has got the journey planned.” While Kate doesnapost want to put any pressure on George, sheaposs keen for him to learn the dference between public and private time early - and used the Euros to teach him a vital lesson.Kate and Wills took George to cheer on the Three Lions at Wembley, when England took on Italy in last yearaposs competition. Duncan said: “That really struck me after seeing George in his first grown-up suit with his parents at the Euros final in July. “People were asking why they hadn’t let him wear an England shirt ‘like a normal eight-year-old’. “William was apparently keen on the idea, but it was Kate, the former commoner, who said no. She was showing George that being ’on duty’ requires a dferent approach… he has to learn to don the royal armour.  “That doesn’t mean hiding his personality or feelings though – so George was encouraged to leap up and celebrate England scoring, to roar and wave and hug his mum and dad like any normal lad. And even to shed a tear when it all ended in heartbreak.Experts have previously claimed the couple would try and keep Georgeaposs future from him for as long as possible.As children, Wills and his brother Harry were well aware of their futures and the younger Wales brother used it in arguments. According to former protection officer Ken Wharfe Harry once told his brother: Youaposll be king one day, I wonapost. Therefore I can do what I want! Speaking about his son, William has previously said: Thereaposll be a time and a place to bring George up and understand how he fits in, in the world. We are very normal. Catherine Mayer, author of Charles: The Heart of a King, told E! News: With George they are trying to delay that moment of realisation and give him normality before they thrust this on him. But it will be, nevertheless, part of his upbringing both in terms of what he sees his parents and grandparents doing and probably quite soon a beginning of an understanding that he is in public le and what that means. news uk-news pub-landlady--one-uks-"UK’s longest serving landlady performs ‘My Way’ on the pianoByPaul Byrne:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsPub landlady Jean Williams is still pulling pints after  years behind the bar. Jean, , is now one of the longest-serving publicans in the UK. And she has no plans to call time and retire. For the past  years, she has been running The Grfin Inn in Gresford, near Wrexham, North Wales. But she started learning her trade when she was just . Jean, who has lived in pubs since the age of eight used to help her late father, Pryce Grfiths, when he was the licensee of the White Lion pub in nearby Hope. And when the members of the local constabulary popped in, the young schoolgirl she would have to make herself scarce. “That was when I started helping behind the bar, though I really shouldn’t have done at that age,” she said.  In m she got her name above the door at The Grfin and the village pub has barely changed in all that time. She has never served food and has shunned modern attractions such as a jukebox, a pool table and satellite TV. “I don’t have any gimmicks” she laughed. There is a pub piano and Jean, who used to play the organ at the village church, can still knock out a tune when asked. She said: “I need to get the piano tuned to be honest, although I’ve been saying that for the last  years!”  One thing that has changed over the decades is the price of beer. “When I started here it was only  pence a pint,” she said. The mum-of-one added: “It is very hard work. People don’t realise how hard it is. “It’s a tough le but I have enjoyed it and I like what I do. It is a way of le for me.  “The customers are fabulous. They keep me going, they are a great crowd. “I suppose I will have to retire some time but not just yet.” Pub regular Andrew Price said: “Jean is a real character and it’s great to come into a pub where you can sit down, have a chat with friends over a pint without loud music, though from time to time Jean is asked to accompany a singalong on the piano. title: size 30 woman flew turkey
story: Size  woman flew to Turkey after psychic predicted shed die without drastic actionRebecca Wilkinson, , from Derbyshire weighed st lbs at her heaviest - but underwent a gastric sleeve operation in  that she said "changed her le"Rebecca Wilkinson flew to Turkey to have surgery that she says changed her le Image: Rebecca Wilkinson   SWNSByKatie Pearson:,  Jan | commentsA woman flew to Turkey to have her stomach removed before losing more than -and-a-half stone after a psychic predicted she would die without drastic action. Rebecca Wilkinson, , started putting on weight in her teens and saw her weight rocket after falling pregnant with her child at  - piling on nearly  stone in just under two years. She would often indulge in two takeaways a day followed by snacks like chocolate, crisps, and sweets - washed down with litres of Lucozade.At her biggest, Rebecca was defined as obese - weighing st lbs and was struggling to squeeze into a size -.After years of dieting the mum-of-one saw no changes until a trip to a psychic scared her into action. He revealed she had no futureshe carried on her unhealthy habits and told her to do whatever it takes or die. The bombshell kicked-started her weight loss journey and she booked a flight to Antalya, Turkey, to undergo a private gastric sleeve operation in September . A year after the operation to remove part of her stomach, she lost a staggering st lb - slimming down to st lb and a svelte size -. Rebecca, an apprentice plasterer, from Ilkeston, Derbyshire, said: “I was desperate after years of trying and failing to lose weight. “During a visit to my psychic, he scared me into action. He said he saw aposno leapos for me on the cards. “He also said: aposDo what it takes - go to the extreme or you will die.apos I knew I had to take drastic actions and surgery was the only way. “The weight has fallen off after having my stomach removed - it’s turned my le around.” Rebecca struggled with bullies during her teens and beyond - turning to food for comfort. She saw the weight start piling on, especially after she fell pregnant with her first child, Libby, . The mum would often tuck into a takeaway for lunch and dinner - followed by snacks. She said: “I went to an all-girls school, and I was bullied really badly. In school, they nicknamed me aposRebecca double-deckerapos because I was bigger than the others girls. I definitely ate to feel better. “I’d start the day with four pieces of buttered toast, andI was peckish at midmorning, I’d easily repeat this. “For lunch, I’d get a takeaway and dinner every single night was a takeaway as well.” As her weight spiralled out of control, Rebecca struggled with her mental health and suffered from anxiety and depression. She hoped for another baby with her partner of  years, Matt, , who owns a plastering company, but struggled to conceive for the next  years due to her weight. At her biggest, she weighed a whopping st lbs and struggled to fit into a size . She said: “For years I tried to ignore the mess I was in. I wouldn’t leave the house without my mum or fiancé by my side. “I was selective over where I went in case I didn’t fit in the seat or the toilet cubicle. I even had people shouting profanities at me from passing cars. Rebecca tried and failed to diet over the years and was left feeling ‘defeated’. She was ready to give up when a trip to visit a psychic in  changed everything. According to Rebecca, he couldn’t see a future for her in the cards and told her to ‘sort it now’ or she would die. “I was sceptical of the psychic at first, but he knew things no one  did,” she said. The way he knew about how I’d eat and ‘hibernate’ afterwards. “I left the reading in tears, but it was important I did. He said: aposI don’t see any le left for you.apos It was the wake-up call I needed to change.” After the reading, Rebecca looked into private surgery for a gastric sleeve in the UK, but it would cost upwards of £,. She found the operation abroad in Turkey costing a fraction of the price - £, - and flew over in September  with her mum, Jayne Nunn, , who also underwent the surgery. The operation involved removing three-quarters of the stomach and the remaining amount formed a apossleeveapos or tube that lead to the intestine. After the surgery, Rebecca flew back to the UK and had to survive on a diet of liquids, purees, and soft foods for a month before being able to eat solid food again. Rebecca continues: My mum came with me and was such a big support. It all went well but it was a lot to adjust to with my new diet. Now I can only eat small amounts every two hours - like a Babybel or a small bit of protein like a salmon fillet. For dinner, Iaposll usually have a very small portion of whatever Iaposve cooked for the family. I donapost feel hunger or miss food. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  Over a year, Rebecca said the weight fell away and she lost a whopping st lb, slimming down to st lb. She now wears a size - and said sheaposs had a whole new lease of le. Her mum Jayne also lost a staggering  stone after the surgery. Rebecca said: The weight has fallen off me - itaposs been amazing. Mum did an incredible job as well. Weaposre hoping toto Turkey for another surgery to remove the excess skin. I gave up my work from home job and now Iaposm an apprentice plasterer. I enjoy super long walks, going out and socialising which I never imagined would be possible. Most importantly, Iaposm able to move around and live pain-free. Hopefully, the weight loss will help with my fertility and having another baby. Itaposs changed my le. story: Student who worked out  times a week overcomes his unhealthy gym obsessionSonny Drinkwater had a moment of realisation during the peak of his spiralling health obsession, which gave him the idea for his new business venture, WellEasySonny Drinkwater has set up the venture with his school friend Image: Sonny Drinkwater  University of BristolByHollie BoneNews ReporterSophie Grubb:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA university graduate who was working out  times a week and counting every calorie, has overcome his unhealthy gym obsession and developed a food app to help others.Sonny Drinkwater, , became obsessed with the gym when an injury meant that he couldnapost row anymore, Bristol Live reports.The University of Bristol graduate started going to the gym to keep fit, but the hobby spiralled into an unhealthy fixation on fitness, and he began limiting his diet to , calories a day - logging absolutely everything he ate. At the peak of his obsession two years ago, he was going to the gym  times in a week and his mental health was taking a huge hit. But in the midst of his struggle he realised there was a business opportunity to help people with specic diet needs or desires, and the idea for his online food shop, WellEasy, was born. Reflecting on his time at university while he spoke to BristolLive, he said: I was quite ill. I got into a spiral of calorie counting and going to the gym obsessively.I’d get up at am for cardio, do weights at lunch and then more cardio in the evening, all while eating exactly , calories a day. It took a massive toll on my mental health. “At the same time I’d go into a shop and find something with four good ingredients that cost £, yet something highly processed with  ingredients would cost  pence. “I realised there must be a better way. Having graduated from university with an integrated Masters in History with Innovation, after five years of studying, Sonny launched the project with his school friend, Joshua Barley. The pair started working out of Sonnyaposs parentaposs home garage, but so far have already secured almost £, of funding to boost their start-up. They are supported by co-founder of online furniture giant Made, Julien Callede, who has been leading them since May this year after joining as a non-executive director. WellEasy members can shop by their lestyle choices and values according to categories like vegan, keto and gluten free, choosing from more than , products across the site.Hundreds of people have already joined, and every new member sponsors a free membership for a low-income family, NHS worker, teacher, student or armed forces veteran as part of the aposWellEasy Caresapos scheme, which  people have signed up to benefit from so far.The venture was a finalist in the University of Bristol’s New Enterprise Competition last year and was part of the universityaposs Foundership Scheme in , designed to equip students with entrepreneurial skills through workshops and networking opportunities. Sonny said: “We wouldn’t have started thisit wasn’t for Bristol Uni and the help their Careers Service gave us with startup workshops, internships and funding. Stuart Johnson, director of the University of Bristol’s Careers Service, said: Sonny’s success as a entrepreneur is all the more inspiring when you consider how radically dferent his lestyle was just a few years ago. WellEasy is making healthy food a viable option for people who otherwise couldn’t afford it. We are proud that Sonny began his journey at Bristol. She was also offered a sht for Sunday morning at the Tesco in Carlton, Nottingham - and spent two whole hours serving customers. Jodie, from Hucknall, said: She was so excited, she mentioned it every morning and she said aposMummy, is it my day to go to work  She went on the tills, Checkout  - itaposs got to be Checkout , I donapost know why! In December, Jodie posted on Facebook askinganyone knew of a way she could get hold of a child-sized Tesco unorm.A worker from the Tesco in Carlton responded saying that sheaposd ask her manager, and a few days later an iconic blue polo and jumper had been made specically for the tot. title: uk weather icy stretches downpours
story: UK weather: Brits set for icy stretches and severe downpours as  flood alerts issuedThe UKs unsettled weather conditions are set to continue with forecasters predicting frosty conditions caused by torrential showers this morningA fresh band of rain moving across the UK is set to give Brits a wet and windy start to the week Image: Alamy Live News.ByNina Lloyd, PARyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsBrits may awaken to icy stretches this morning after heavy downpours and plunging temperatures battered the isles overnight, forecasters say.Western Scotland, Northern Ireland, north-west England and North Wales could face frosty conditions, caused by showers expected to last until Sunday morning, according to the Met Office.It comes as forecasters predict a miserable cloudy and drizzly start to the week as a new rain front is set to soak Brits as it sweeps across the country.Wet and windy weather caused very unsettled conditions across other parts of the UK on Saturday and temperatures were expected to plunge to minus C overnight in some higher grounds.Flood alerts were issued across England and Wales as rising water levels left rivers at risk of overflowing.  The Environment Agency had  alerts in place in England, for areas such as Bristol and Somerset, as well as six in Wales, including for the upper Severn in Powys. Met Office meteorologist Jonathan Vautrey said: There are no official ice warnings out at the moment that we have issued but we are sending out a message in general that there is an isolated risk that any wet surfaces along with these showers could lead to icy stretches. This is mainly due to the showers that will be feeding in from the west. By the end of Sunday night, higher areas in Scotland, the Pennines and Snowdonia are also likely to see some snow.  Mr Vautrey said any ice would be likely to have melted away by Sunday morning when the showers are expected to ease. Most of the ice risk will have abated before people are getting out and about, he said.  After the frost risk dissipates, commuters are likely to face a cloudy, drizzly start to the week as another band of rain is forecast across the UK. High pressure coming from the south on Wednesday is set to bring more settled weather in general from midweek onwards, with dry conditions expected for most of the country. Overnight frost and fog patches will accompany the incoming settled weather.Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Met OfficeEnvironment AgencySnowWeatherFloods" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. story: Woman appalled to see couple engage in sex act before smirking at her on trainThe commuter, who wanted to remain anonymous, said she was "so uncomfortable" by the act on a train from Bristol to Cleethorpes, and claims the pair smirked at her when she left the trainBritish Transport Police received a report about the couple Image: AFP via Getty ImagesByLuke GreenGraeme Murray:,  Jan A woman was appalled after she claims she saw a couple engage in a sex act while she was travelling on a train.She noticed the pair in a compromising position while travelling aboard a TransPennine Express service just after New Year, GrimsbyLive reports.As the train neared its destination she was astonished to hear the man undo his belt to engage in the indecent activity. The commuter, who wishes to remain anonymous, was travelling from Bristol to Cleethorpes on January  when she noticed the pair . She was shocked to hear the man undo his belt to engage in the indecent activity before the train arrived.  GrimsbyLive reports how she sat opposite the couple rather than a drunk group of men nearby because she thought they seemed nice.But she was so uncomfortable by the act, and claims the pair smirked at her when she left the train. She said: I was on the .pm train from Sheffield to Cleethorpes and got on the carriage which had a group of drunken lads and a nice looking couple on. I sat opposite the couple as they looked nice and I felt Iaposd be better sat next to them than the drunken men. It was all fine until we got to Scunthorpe. At this point, I heard the manaposs belt unbuckle and wondered what on Earth was going on  After a while, the man had his pants down - I didnapost know where to look. I was coughing loudly and looking out the window to try and make them aware that I was there. At one point, the man pulled his coat over the lady, but you could clearly see what was going on. I just felt so uncomfortable. At Cleethorpes, both myself and the couple got off the train and I just shook my head at the pair of them, but they just looked at me and smirked. The woman told the staff at the train station before informing the British Transport Police about the incident. She continued: Itaposs the strangest thing Iaposve ever seen, but I definitely didnapost want to see it. They must have been in their s, I was just so shocked they would even think about doing something like that. I felt incredibly uncomfortable throughout the whole thing. I spent £ on aticket from Bristol to Cleethorpes and that is not what I wanted to experience. A spokesperson for British Transport Police said: We received a report on January  of a couple engaging in a sexual act onboard a train Cleethorpes. The incident occurred on January . Further witnesses or anyone with information can contact BTP by texting  or calling     quoting reference  of   . A TransPennine Express spokesperson said: “The safety and comfort of our customers and colleagues is of paramount importance to us and we are sorry for any distress experienced during this journey. “This type of behaviour is unacceptable, and we are now working closely with colleagues at British Transport Police to identy and trace those responsible.” Read MoreRead MoreFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON British Transport PoliceCrime" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. story: Woman wins familys home for just £ - and never has to pay a penny on mortgageAdam Thwaites and his we Liz raffled their home to raise cash for Grace House, specically to enable the charity to buy a wheelchair-accessible swing for children with disabilitiesAdam and Liz Thwaites Image: HandoutByAaron MorrisGraeme Murray:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA woman has won a family home for the low price of £ after a couple raffled off their house to raise cash for charity. Adam Thwaites and his we Liz chose to put their three-bedroom home into a raffle for £ per ticket.The couple wanted to raise money for Grace House to allow the organisation to buy a wheelchair-accessible swing, which cost £,. Speaking to ChronicleLive last year, Adam said: We always planned on selling our home this year. We want to move closer to family, work, and Emily’s nursery.Over the last couple of years though, weaposve been following other property competitions, and something about it made us fall in love with the idea.  What’s more, there were loads of people who were using the opportunity to raise money for charities that meant something to them. Liz works at Grace House, a charity providing short breaks for disabled children and I was talking to the Registered Manager one day about their need for a wheelchair-accessible swing. Emily loves the swings in the park so much it made me feel sad that not everyone had the opportunity to have a go on them. We did a bit of Googling and saw these swings are around £,.  Obviously, I put two and two together and Liz and I decided that we should go for it and try to raffle off our home, enabling us to move, letting someone win an amazing prize in time for Christmas and also raising funds for Grace House. Thousands participated in the raffle and , tickets were issued as the competition came to a close. Adam and Liz fell short of their , ticket goal, but they managed to raise enough to both give away their home while still raising the first £, towards the sought after swing for Grace House.Adam told ChronicleLive : We were able to give away our home as the prize after , tickets were issued, far short of our initial goal but this has helped us to raise the first £, for the swing for Grace House. We’ve now set up a fundraising page with the help of Laura Forbesto try to raise some further funds to help buy the swing.If anyone would like to make a donation they can do so here.The competition closed on Christmas Eve and a woman was revealed as the winner of their home. Georgie Robinson, , who lives in Carlisle put her name in the hat by buying  tickets for a pound per piece.  She was overwhelmed with emotion after receiving an email to tell her she had won the competition. Georgie said: It was a shock, you just donapost imagine that youaposre going to win do you  Everyone hopes but you never think that itaposs going to happen. I bought  tickets - I put some on when the raffle first came out, then a month later I thought aposIaposll just put on a few more.apos When I found out Iaposd won, I was in that much shock...I was supposed to wrap presents after too! Working in the Navy while trying to save for a house with her partner has proved dficult for Georgie, especially with travelling expenses. And she says that winning the house outright, where she can live mortgage-free has changed her le for the better. She is now in process of relocating and transferring ownership and is excited to start her new le on the Northeast coast. Her father also lives nearby and will help her settle in. Georgie added: Winning has been a massive help, Iaposm in the Navy and I pay a lot travelling around back and forth from home, and itaposs just been really hard to save - so this is le-changing really. Adam added: We are in the process of transferring the ownership of our property to Georgie now and she is coming to visit us on Thursday evening and to look around in person. Georgie said that when we called her to tell her she had won our home, that aposthe shock came overapos and that she couldn’t think straight. She had planned on wrapping presents that night but had to go straight to bed to let the good news sink in and get over the shock of what had happened. She also asked us not to stress about finding somewhere new to live quickly as she’s not going to kick us out. title: im uninviting cousins wedding leaking
story: Im uninviting my cousins from my wedding for leaking info to my estranged mumA man has uninvited his cousins from his wedding after discovering theyd been sending information about him to his mum, who he hasnt spoken to since he was The man hasnt spoken to his mum since he was  Image: Getty Images WestendByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Jan | comments A groom-to-be has revealed how heaposs uninvited his own cousins from his wedding, after discovering theyaposd been leaking information about him to his estranged mum.The -year-old, who has no brothers or sisters, hasnapost spoken to his mum since he was a teen after she had an affair, and has cut ties with the whole family, with the exception of a couple of cousins.Iaposm an only child and when I was  my parents orced when my dad found out my mum cheated on him. This was devastating to my dad as my parents were best friends and started dating when they were , the man explained on Redditaposs AITA forum.I played sports and my dad was my coach so I had a much closer relationship to him then my mum. I was supposed to spend one week at my mumaposs then the next week at my dads. But I would usually just lock myself in my room at my mumaposs. Usually my dad would drop me off and I would get on my bike and ride the couple miles back to his house.  He added: My mum would ask me things and I would literally pretend like she didn’t exist. It got so bad that lawyers got involved thinking my dad was turning me against my mum. My dad encouraged me to spend time with my mum, but I couldn’t. My mum tried putting us in therapy but I would just sit there till the time was up not saying a word to her. Eventually my mum broke down and let me just live with my dad. The man hasnapost spoken to his mum since he as  and would even ask his dad to get her to leaveshe turned up to watch his games. She would try to speak to him at the end of matches and he would walk right past her without even acknowledging. I cut her whole family off besides a few of my cousins that were around my age. She showed up to my high school graduation and I asked a couple teachers to remove her and they did. She never dated anyone  to my knowledge and was still attempting to reconcile with my dad a few years before he passed, calling it the aposbiggest mistake of her leapos and begging my dad to forgive her, he continued. When my dad passed a couple years ago she tried to show up to the funeral and I met her outside to ask her to leave. My fiancée Rachel was with me when I did this and my mum cried after learning we were engaged saying she couldn’t believe I hated her still this many years later. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Last week the man received a letter from his mum with a large cheque inside. In the letter she told him she couldnapost live with herself not being invited to her only sonaposs wedding and that the whole family is so upset theyaposve cut off. She also told him sheaposd been keeping tabs on him via his cousins. I ripped the cheque up and sent it back to theaddress. She shouldn’t have even known my address as I keep her blocked on all social media. I called up my cousins who admitted that since I was  they have been providing my mum with updates on me prom pics, college updates, engagement photos and they sent her my address, he continued. I was so mad that I told them they wouldn’t be invited to the wedding anymore because I don’t want my mum getting access to it. Rachel is saying I’m going too far now and uninviting my cousins along with freezing out my mumaposs whole family because of her actions is an a**hole move. The man to Reddit to question whether he was taking it too far by uninviting his cousins. Acting out as a -year-old is to be expected. Deciding not to ever forgive your mum is totally your right , one Reddit user commented. The fact that you are still throwing tantrums like a -year-old, at the age of , makes you the a**hole. Another added: Why are you punishing your mum so severely  She made an awful mistake years ago, a mistake many parents do. They have a right to their own lives and moral failings. Honestly I would encourage you to explore why you feel this hatred for your mum that seems disproportionate. Punishing your cousins for showing compassion does seem like going too far.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news weird-news sassy-sausage-dogs-three-minutes-"Sausage dogs: Cute and funny dachshund videosByBethan ShufflebothamNiche Writer:,  Jan | commentsSassy, stubborn sausage dog pups have grown in popularity over the years, and they’re a breed that know what they like and will go to any s to get it. These loving long dogs very much enjoy a tummy tickle from the people they know and adore, as well as a Starbucks puppuccino with scrambled eggs on the side. These silly slinky dogs have provided endless laughs for social media users with their mischievous antics, from sneaking through stair gates to refusing to go any quicker than their own pace. So here are three minutes of chaos and eight stories about a dachshunds that will make your day. You’ve got a friend in me Miniature dachshund Nellie Bean is besotted with her new cuddly toy that hasan uncanny resemblance to herself. The TikToker, nelliebeandaxie, stole viewers hearts as her owner showed them how inseparable Nellie Bean and her new sausage dog stuffy have become.The pup has a real affinity for toys designed in her likeness, as the video shows her excitement when playing with both a balloon and a stuffed animal designed in the shape of Miniature Dachshunds. But her best friend is clearly the teddy, as the pup is seen running and playing with the toy in her mouth, even cuddling it while she sleeps, all while the song ‘You’ve Got A Friend In Me’ from the film Toy Story plays in the background. Pampered pups  Three sausage dogs called Peaches, Mitzi and Challah are quite possibly the most pampered pups on the internet.The trio of daxieshave their own lounge in their owners’ home , complete with a ” TV, bar cart, fish tank and sofas. TikTok user @ bam shared the miniature room with his followers, and has amassed millions of views for his handiwork and dedication to making his pets’ apartment so beautul.The room features three dog sofas, from Wayfair, paintings and prints hung in frames at dog height, as well as lamps, rugs and pet-friendly houseplants. The bar cart is actually a bathroom organiser spray painted gold, adorned with miniature alcohol bottles and whiskey glasses to complete the look. Imaginary fireplace friend  This lonely dog was desperate for a friend.The daxie puppy whothought another dog lives with himwas left gutted when his doppelganger wouldn’t play with him.Zero, known as ‘Zero the Doxie’, believes there is a dog in the fireplace that simply doesnapost want to have fun. The pup sits patiently at the switched-off fireplace gazing into the black glass where he can see ‘another’ dachshund in the reflection, waiting for them to play. Where’s my Starbucks  Sassy sausage dog Harlee knows when her puppuccino isn’t Starbucks, andwill refuse to drink from any other cup.But her owner has worked out an ingenious way to dupe her into thinking he’s lapping up the popular beverage from Starbucks. The demanding dog turns his nose up at a whipped cream treat in a regular cup, but the Liverpool pupaposs owner has saved a branded paper cup to trick him. After refusing to eat a ‘fake’ puppuccino, his owner scoops the cream into their trusty Starbucks cup, adding extra cream with ‘aerosol cream sound effects for extra convincing’, before presenting it to the pup.Harlee - who has k Instagram followers - sticks his snoot straight in the cup to enjoy his ‘real’ Starbucks puppuccino, saying it’s ‘so much better’.The sausage with  pairs of shoes  Biscuit the dachshund has  pairs of shoes - and dog crocs in every colour. The five-year-old dog, from Piatra Neamț, in Romania, also has a whole wardrobe of colour coordinated clothes with matching hats, wigs and collars.His owner, Lavi Roz has spent nearly £, on wardrobe accessories for her beloved dog, with one pair of Crocs donning Swarovski crystals. The daxie also owns  pairs of sunglasses without lenses, and poses for pictures which are shared with his , Instagram followers.No scrambled eggs  Don’t want it…  Dusty is a a daxie who knows what she wants, and it certainly isn’t kibble with carrots and peas.This sassy dog wanted scrambled eggs for breakfast, so when her owner presented her with the dry food. Dusty quicklyshoves the bowl away in a huff.“Nope, get it away from me. I don’t want that brown ****,” the voiceover says. “I’ve seen what you’re having for tea and you offer me this  How dare you, it’s an insult.” In fairness to Dusty, she just recently gave birth to six puppies, so perhaps she feels deserving of something a bit fancier as a hard-working new mother. Dusty’s owner Chloe Booth says that it’s not unusual for the a dog to refuse her standard dog food in favour of scrambled eggs, boiled chicken or fish, adding: “She thinks she’s Queen of the house.” One speed sausage dog  Buster the sausage dog is well-known online for a hilarious personality trait.The daxie has justone speed on his walkies - slow.Buster prefers to take his time, making sure he really squeezes the maximum amount of enjoyment out of his daily exercise. Perfectly happy to go at his own pace, Buster lets his more energetic siblings lead the way, trotting along at the back by himself. In a video clip, viewers are first shown two of Buster’s siblings on their walk, both going at the same pace. But then the camera pans back around  yards to show us Buster, who is trotting along at a much slower pace and showing no signs of getting any faster. Can’t stop me now A miniature dachshund was so determined to get upstairs to find her owner, she found anincredible way to defeat a stair gateand cardboard barrier designed to stop her.Fteen-month-old dachshund Nala followed her heart and managed to squeeze her way through a narrow gap in the gate. She also maneuvered her way over a large cardboard barrier that was there to make it extra dficult. In the video, Nala can be seen pushing her back legs in an attempt to get over the cardboard, and with a few kicks she gets over to the other side and takes no hesitation in rushing upstairs to her owner, Keira. title: this how wash hair winter
story: This is how I wash my hair in winter to keep it fluffy and stop it drying outA hair care expert has shared her fool proof hack for keeping hair fluffy and soft in winter, from what products to use and even the temperature of your showerThis could be an absolute game-changer Image: @golabbeauty   TikTokByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Jan | comments Winter is well and truly upon us, and for many of us that means dry skin, cracked lips and brittle dry hair. Itaposs all fun and games.Luckily for us, one hair care expert has shared her top tips for washing your hair in winter, which could make the world of dference to your hair health and even promote more growth.The lady behind Golâb Beauty @golabbeautyhas amassed more than a million followers on TikTok thanks to sharing hints and tricks for keeping hair healthy and fresh all year round.In her latest clip, she revealed her winter hair washing routine which ensures hair stays fluffy and healthy without going dry and brittle in the winter months. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. To start off with, she revealed she puts conditioner on the middle to the ends of her hair first in order to prevent it from drying out from the shampoo, which we didnapost even know was a thing but everyday is a school day. Next, she takes the shampoo and rubs it between the palms of her hands to emulsy it before applying. I only shampoo my scalp, any shampoo that gets on my ends slides off because of the conditioner, she explained, adding: I only wash my endsI have product build up. Then she reapplies her conditioner and leaves it on for free minutes, before rinsing with coldwater, to prevent frizz. One follower commented: Iaposm not joking, I did this and my hair has felt so soft since, while another added: Literally thank you so much because my hair has been feeling like hay.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news weird-news woman-left-worst-tattoo-ever-"TikToker suffers hilarious tattoo failByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Jan | comments Getting a tattoo is a huge commitment because, after all, itaposs stuck on your body for le.So, you can imagine why one woman was left in floods of tears after going to get her latest inking, only to discover the tattoo artist had misunderstood what she wanted entirely. Izzy, from Boise in Idaho, was on holiday at a friendaposs house in Pittsburgh when she went to a parlour to request an illustration of a mobile phone, in homage to Mac Milleraposs  track Missed Calls. However, things didnapost quite go to plan once Izzy took a closer look at the inking and discovered that the artist had completely misunderstood her instructions.In a TikTok shared from her handle @izzy, Izzy sobbed: I just got the worst f***king tattoo. I got my cellphone from Mac Miller and told her I wanted it  by  size. She tattooed the f**king  by . How do I fix that A close up shot of the tattoo revealed that the artist had in fact written aposxapos on the screen of the mobile phone, without realising it was a size reference. Many TikTok users were quick to question how Izzy hadnapost noticed the extra writing on the stencil, but in a follow up clip, she explained it was a genuine mistake. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. I know Iaposm stupid, I know it was my fault but I have  tattoos, like Iaposve been through this before. I live in Idaho and Iaposm in Pittsburgh for the week so I went to the shop that I didnapost know, she explained. My friend that Iaposm visiting here has been to that shop before and never had a bad experience so we made the appointment and it was supposed to be fine. The  by  I didnapost see it on the stencil when she first drew it up. She added: I wanted the cell phone to say missed calls for Mac Miller aposcos I visited the blue slide park while Iaposm here, referencing the playground which inspired his debut album. So I saw it on the paper before she printed it off. I thought that was for a size reference, I wanted it  by  size. When she was doing the tattoo she had me lay down flat with my arm completely bent sideways weird. When I did look over it was mostly just like her head, I couldnapost really see it.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: baby boy lost during afghanistan
story: Baby handed to soldier during Afghanistan airlt reunited with family after long ordealSohail Ahmadi was just two months old when he went missing on August  as thousands of people rushed to leave Afghanistan as it fell to the TalibanSohail Ahmadi was just two months old when he went missing on Auust  as thousands of people rushed to leave Afghanistan as it fell to the TalibanByMica RosenbergJonathan LandayJames MackenzieTanveer Mann:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A baby boy who was handed to a soldier in desperation at an airport during the chaos of the American evacuation of Afghanistan has been found and reunited with his relatives. Sohail Ahmadi was just two months old when he went missing on August  as thousands of people rushed to leave Afghanistan as it fell to the Taliban. His family, who had been evacuated to the United States, had no idea where he was until a story was published by Reuters back in November about him with his pictures and he was located in Kabul. A -year-old taxi driver named Hamid Safi had found him in the airport and took him home to raise as his own. After over a month of negotiations and pleas, and ultimately a brief detention by Taliban police, Safi finally handed the child back to his grandfather and other relatives still in Kabul. They said they would now reunite him with his parents and siblings in the US.  During the tumultuous Afghan evacuation over the summer, Mirza Ali Ahmadi, the boyaposs father who had worked as a security guard at the U.S. embassy, and his we Suraya, feared their son would get crushed in the crowd as they neared the airport gates en route to a flight to the United States. Ahmadi said in early November that in his desperation that day, he handed Sohail over the airport wall to a unormed soldier who he believed to be an American, fully expecting he would soon make it the remaining  metersto the entrance to reclaim him. Just at that moment, Taliban forces pushed the crowd back and it would be another half an hour before Ahmadi, his we and their four other children were able to get inside. But by then the baby was nowhere to be found. Ahmadi said he searched desperately for his son inside the airport and was told by officials that he had likely been taken out of the country separately and could be reunited with them later. The rest of the family was evacuated - eventually ending up at a military base in Texas. For months they had no idea where their son was.  Many other parents were in a similar situation, becoming separated from their children during the hasty evacuation effort and withdrawal of U.S. forces from the country after a -year war. With no U.S. embassy in Afghanistan and international organizations overstretched, Afghan refugees have had trouble getting answers on the timing, or possibility, of complex reunications like this one. The U.S. Department of Defense, the State Department and the Department of Homeland Security did not respond to requests for comment on Saturday. On the same day Ahmadi and his family were separated from their baby, Safi had slipped through the Kabul airport gates after giving a ride to his brotheraposs family who were also set to evacuate. Safi said he found Sohail alone and crying on the ground.  After he said he unsuccessfully tried to locate the babyaposs parents inside, he decided to take the infant home to his we and children. Safi has three daughters of his own and said his motheraposs greatest wish before she died was for him to have a son. In that moment he decided: I am keeping this baby. If his family is found, I will give him to them. If not, I will raise him myself.Safi said he took him to the doctor for a check-up after he was found and quickly incorporated the child into his family. They called the baby Mohammad Abed and posted pictures of all the children together on his Facebook page.After the Reuters story about the missing child came out, some of Safiaposs neighbors - who had noticed hisfrom the airport months earlier with a baby - recognized the photos and posted comments about his whereabouts on a translated version of the article. Ahmadi asked his relatives still in Afghanistan, including his father-in-law Mohammad Qasem Razawi, , who lives in the northeastern province of Badakhshan, to seek out Safi and ask him toSohail to the family. Razawi said he traveled two days and two nights to the capital bearing gts - including a slaughtered sheep, several pounds of walnuts and clothing - for Safi and his family.  But Safi refused to release Sohail, insisting he also wanted to be evacuated from Afghanistan with his family. Safiaposs brother, who was evacuated to Calornia, said Safi and his family have no pending applications for U.S. entry. The babyaposs family sought help from the Red Cross, which has a stated mission to help reconnect people separated by international crises, but said they received little information from the organization. A spokesperson for the Red Cross said it does not comment on inidual cases. Finally, after feeling they had run out of options, Razawi contacted the local Taliban police to report a kidnapping. Safi denied the allegations to the police and said he was caring for the baby, not kidnapping him. The complaint was investigated and dismissed and the local police commander helped arrange a settlement, which included an agreement signed with thumbprints by both sides. Razawi said the babyaposs family in the end agreed to compensate Safi around , Afghanifor expenses incurred looking after him for five months. The gandfather of the baby complained to us and we found Hamid and based on the evidence we had, we recognized the baby, said Hamid Malang, the chief area controller of the local police station. With both sides in agreement, the baby will be handed over to his grandfather, he said on Saturday. In the presence of the police, and amid lots of tears, the baby was finally ed to his relatives.  Razawi said Safi and his family were devastated to lose Sohail. Hamid and his we were crying, I cried too, but assured them that you both are young, Allah will give you male child. Not one, but several. I thanked both of them for saving the child from the airport, Razawi said. The babyaposs parents told Reuters they were overjoyed as they were able to see with their own eyes the reunion over video chat. There are celebrations, dance, singing, said Razawi. It is just like a wedding indeed. Now Ahmadi and his we and other children, who in early December were able to move off the military base and resettle in an apartment in Michigan, hope Sohail will soon be brought to the United States. We need to get the baby back to his mother and father. This is my only responsibility, his grandfather said. My wish is that he shouldto them. title: devoted dog lover spends 11000
story: Devoted dog lover spends £, on  drones to celebrate spoiled pups th birthdayThe drones spelt out the words "Happy th birthday to Doudou" as his owner and her pals, from central Chinas Hunan province, sang to the bemused poochThe elaborate celebration was held to mark pampered pet Doudous th birthday Image: NewsflareByDave BurkeSenior News Reporter:,  Jan | commentsA devoted dog lover shelled out more than £, for an elaborate drone display to mark her petaposs th birthday. The woman rented  devices, which spelt out the words Happy th birthday to Doudou to mark the poochaposs big day. It happened in central China’s Hunan province - but authorities were none too impressed. The lavish display, which cost , yuan - the equivalent of £, - was carried out in violation of no-fly zones, meaning the drones were at risk of being shot down. As the message lit up the sky, the unnamed woman and her pals sang Happy Birthday to Doudou.  The drones also formed patterns showing a birthday cake and a box containing a bone.According to the South China Morning Post, the generous owner chose to have  drones because the numberaposs pronunciation in Mandarin sounds similar to I love you.Spoiled dog Doudou was pictured watching on mystied as the unusual celebration unfolded. But an official told the newspaper that his owner should have obtained permission before the drones took to the skies.  The spot, close to the Xiangjiang River in Changsha, is home to a number of high-rise buildings, with a strict no-fly zone in place for security. Police have said they shoot down dronesthey are spotted, but in this instance they seem to have not noticed until Doudouaposs celebration was over. title: medic 32 becomes first woman
story: Brit who made history crossing South Pole now stuck there after Covid outbreakPreet Chandi, , from Derby, made it safely to the Antarctica but is now stranded after the pilots due to fly her to Chile contracted CovidPreet Chandi is stranded in the South Pole after a Covid outbreak Image: Preet Chandi BPM MediaByFaith Pring:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA British army medic who made history by becoming the first woman of colour to trek across the Antarctic is now stranded at the South Pole after a Covid outbreak. Preet Chandi, , from Derby, travelled  miles in  days, facing temperatures of -c on her journey last week.But she is now unable to fly back to Chile as the pilots due to take her have contracted the virus, reports Derbyshire Live. Having travelled to the Union Glacier, Preet will fly to the South American country before ing to the UK in the coming days,all goes to plan.  When she arrives in Chile she will have an Internet connection for the first time in more than a month.Since completing the trek, there has been an outpouring of support for the army captain, including from Prime Minister Boris Johnson.The Prime Minister commended Preet on her journey, saying: “What an extraordinary achievement. Congratulations Captain Preet Chandi.”  As she travelled across the continent, Preet told her followers on social media how she sometimes struggled to keep up her motivation. Speaking on December , she said: “Today felt like one of my hardest days. Not because of the terrain, as the Sastrugi are getting smaller and I had good visibility as well. “But I haven’t been sleeping a huge amount and I think that’s caught up to me. “I was sick a few times today which is actually just annoying because you don’t want to take your facemask off, really not what you want when you’re out here.”But, she persevered and successfully made it to the South Pole after more than a month hiking in the freezing cold weather.Preet told Forces News how she’s hoping toto the Antarctic and complete a longer journey. She said: “I’m hoping to come back and do a crossing and a bit of a longer journey. “I don’t quite know when I’ll come back yet but as soon as I can get the funding and the time away from work, then that’s the next stage.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Boris JohnsonPoliticsCoronavirusBritish Army Service" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily coronavirus email newsletter with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you.
